intro: Ranunculus leiocladus, commonly known as the white wood ranunculus, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It features delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy, cup-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, adding a charming touch to woodland gardens. Ranunculus leiocladus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in shady garden settings.
